bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: agreement to mediate means an agreement referred to in section 14;
court means the Supreme Court of British Columbia;
date of trial means the date set for trial in a notice of trial filed under the Supreme Court Family Rules;
deliver means, in relation to a delivery under this regulation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: personally deliver,
mail by ordinary mail to the mailing address the intended recipient has provided for such deliveries,
transmit by fax to the fax number the intended recipient has provided for such deliveries, or
transmit by email to the email address the intended recipient has provided for such deliveries;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: family law proceeding means a proceeding in which relief is claimed under the Family Law Act or the Divorce Act (Canada);
mediation means a collaborative process in which two or more parties meet and attempt, with the assistance of a mediator, to resolve issues in dispute between them;
mediation session means a meeting between two or more parties to a family law proceeding during which they are engaged in mediation;
mediator means a neutral and impartial facilitator with no decision making power who assists parties in negotiating a mutually acceptable settlement of issues in dispute between them;
participant means a party to a family law proceeding who has not been exempted, under section 23 (c) or section 25 (c), from attending the mediation session;
pre-mediation meeting means a meeting referred to in section 13;
roster organization means any body designated by the Attorney General to select mediators for the purposes of this regulation;
serve has the same meaning as in the Supreme Court Family Rules.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to family law proceedings.
Subject to sections 2 and 4, any party to a family law proceeding may initiate mediation in that proceeding by serving a Notice to Mediate (Family) in Form 1 on every other party to the proceeding.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Not more than one mediation under this regulation in any proceeding
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless the court otherwise orders, not more than one mediation may be initiated under this regulation in relation to any family law proceeding.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: When notice to mediate must be served
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless the court otherwise orders, a Notice to Mediate may be served under section 3 no earlier than 90 days after the filing of the first response to family claim in the family law case and no later than 90 days before the date of trial.
The participants must jointly appoint a mutually acceptable mediator within 14 days after the Notice to Mediate has been served on all parties.
If the participants do not jointly appoint a mutually acceptable mediator within the time required by section 6, any participant may apply to a roster organization for an appointment of a mediator.
The following procedure applies if an application to a roster organization is made under section 7:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the roster organization must, within 7 days after receiving the application, communicate to all participants an identical list containing at least 6 names of possible mediators;
each participant must, within 7 days after receipt of the list referred to in paragraph (a),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: delete from the list up to 2 names to which the participant objects,
number the remaining names on the list in order of preference, and
deliver the amended list to the roster organization;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a participant does not deliver the amended list within the time referred to in paragraph (b), the participant is deemed to have accepted all of the names;

within 7 days after the expiry of the 7 day period referred to in paragraph (b), the roster organization must select the mediator from the remaining names on the list or, if no names remain on that list, from any available mediators, whether or not the selected mediator was included on the original list provided under paragraph (a), taking into account the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the order of preference indicated by the participants on the returned lists;
the need for the mediator to be neutral and independent;
the qualifications of the mediator;
the mediator's fees;
the mediator's availability;
any other consideration likely to result in the selection of an impartial, competent and effective mediator.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Promptly after a roster organization selects the mediator, the roster organization must notify the participants in writing of that selection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Deemed date of appointment of mediator
bcl:section.bcl:text: The mediator selected by a roster organization is deemed to be appointed by the participants on the date that the notice is sent under section 9.

If the mediator selected by the roster organization under section 8 (d) is unable or unwilling to act as mediator, the selected mediator or any participant may so notify the roster organization and the roster organization must, within 7 days after receiving that notice, select a new mediator in accordance with section 8 (d).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Separate pre-mediation meetings must be held
bcl:section.bcl:text: The mediator must hold a pre-mediation meeting separately with each participant before a mediation session.
At a pre-mediation meeting with a participant, the mediator must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: undertake a screening process for power imbalance, domestic violence and abuse, and assess whether mediation is appropriate in the circumstances determined from that process,
discuss with the participant the importance of independent legal advice, and
endeavour to have the participant consider all organizational matters relating to the mediation including the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the issues that are to be dealt with during the mediation process;
pre-mediation disclosure of documents;
exchange of documents;
obtaining and exchanging expert reports;
scheduling;
review and signing of an agreement to mediate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An agreement to mediate referred to in section 13 (c) (vi) must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: information about the mediation process,
information about the fees and disbursements the mediator will charge, and
a statement that the mediator has discussed with the participants that it is important for them to obtain independent legal advice.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power of mediator to end process
bcl:section.bcl:text: Without limiting any other of the mediator's rights and powers in relation to the mediation process, at any time after the mediator has held a pre-mediation meeting, the mediator may end the mediation process if the mediator, in the mediator's sole discretion, concludes that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: mediation is not appropriate, or
the mediation process will not be productive

bcl:section.bcl:text: and so advises the participants.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Participants must attend pre-mediation meeting and mediation session
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless relieved under section 23 or 25 of the obligation to attend, each participant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: attend a pre-mediation meeting,
before the mediation session, sign an agreement to mediate, and
attend a mediation session in relation to the proceeding.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 16 but subject to section 18, a participant referred to in section 16 may attend one or both of a pre-mediation meeting and a mediation session by representative if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the participant is under legal disability and the representative is that participant's litigation guardian, or
the participant is authorized to do so by the court on application.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A representative who attends a mediation session in the place of a participant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be familiar with all of the relevant facts on which the participant, on whose behalf the representative attends, intends to rely, and
have full authority to settle, or have access at the earliest practicable opportunity to a person who has full authority to settle, on behalf of that participant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Participants and representatives may be accompanied by counsel
bcl:section.bcl:text: A participant or representative who attends a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session may be accompanied by counsel.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Other persons may attend with consent
bcl:section.bcl:text: Any other person may,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with the consent of the participant with whom a pre-mediation meeting is held, attend the pre-mediation meeting, or
with the consent of all the participants, attend a mediation session.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person required or entitled to attend a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session may attend that meeting or mediation session by telephone or other communications medium if authorized to do so by the mediator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Parties to a family law proceeding need not attend a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session if all of the parties to the proceeding have already been involved in a mediation session in relation to the matters in issue in that proceeding.
A judicial case conference is not a mediation session for the purposes of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A party need not attend a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a party has obtained against another party a protection order, including, without limitation, a protection order under section 183 of the Family Law Act or a peace bond under section 810 of the Criminal Code,
the mediator advises the participants under section 15 that mediation is not appropriate or that the mediation process will not be productive,
the party is exempted from participating in the mediation process under section 25, or
the participants agree that the party need not participate in the mediation process and that agreement is confirmed by the mediator in writing.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A mediation session must occur within 60 days after the appointment of the mediator but not later than 14 days before the date of trial unless a later specified date

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is agreed on by all participants and that agreement is confirmed by the mediator in writing, or
is ordered by the court.

bcl:section.bcl:text: On an application, the court may order that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the mediation proceed on the terms and conditions, if any, and at the time or times, that the court considers appropriate,
the mediation be adjourned to a later date on the terms and conditions that the court considers appropriate, or
one or more of the parties is exempt from participating in the mediation process if, in the court's opinion, it is impracticable or materially unfair to require the party to attend.

bcl:section.bcl:text: On an application for an order referred to in section 24 (b), the court

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must take into account all of the circumstances, including

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: whether the mediation will be more likely to succeed if it is postponed to allow the participants to acquire more information, and
any other circumstances the court considers appropriate, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may make any order referred to in section 25.

bcl:section.bcl:text: At least 14 days before the mediation session is to be held in relation to a proceeding, each participant must deliver to the mediator a Statement of Facts and Issues in Form 2 setting out the factual and legal basis for the participant's claim or opposition to the relief sought in the proceeding.
Promptly after receipt of all the Statements of Facts and Issues required to be delivered under section 27, the mediator must deliver each participant's statement to each of the other participants.
The participants must complete a fee declaration in accordance with section 30, before or at the mediation session.
A fee declaration under section 29 must be in Form 3 and must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disclose the cost of the mediation services, and
contain a declaration by the participants that the cost of the mediation will be paid

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: equally by the participants, or
on any other specified basis agreed by the participants.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A fee declaration completed under this rule is binding on the participants.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Costs may include mediation cost component
bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 31, nothing in section 30 or in the fee declaration completed under this regulation precludes there being included in the disbursements awarded to a party in the proceeding an amount to compensate the party for the share of the cost of the mediation that that party paid under the declaration.

Subject to section 13, the mediator may conduct a pre-mediation meeting and the mediation in any manner the mediator considers appropriate to assist the participants to reach a resolution that is timely, fair and cost-effective.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any participant who is of the opinion that any other participant has failed to comply with a provision of this regulation may make application to the court for an order under section 35.

A participant bringing an application under subsection (1) must do so in accordance with the Supreme Court Family Rules and, without limiting this, must, before making that application, serve on each of the other participants

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an Allegation of Default in Form 4 respecting the participant who is alleged to have failed to comply with a provision of this regulation, and
any affidavits in support of the application.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On an application referred to in section 34 (1), the court may do any one or more of the following unless the participant in respect of whom the Allegation of Default is filed satisfies the court that the default did not occur or that there is a reasonable excuse for the default:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adjourn the application and make an order, on any terms the court considers appropriate, that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a pre-mediation meeting occur, or
a mediation session occur;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adjourn the application and make an order that a participant attend one or both of a pre-mediation meeting and a mediation session;
adjourn the application and make an order that a participant deliver a Statement of Facts and Issues to the mediator;
stay the action until the participant in respect of whom the allegation is filed attends one or both of a pre-mediation meeting and a mediation session;
make any order it considers appropriate with respect to costs.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the court considers that public disclosure of the Allegation of Default and related affidavits would be a hardship on a participant, the court may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: order that the whole or any part of the Allegation of Default and related affidavits be sealed in an envelope and that no person may search the sealed documents without an order of the court, or
make such other order respecting confidentiality of those documents as the court considers appropriate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Court may consider default in ordering costs
bcl:section.bcl:text: The court may consider a default in making any order about costs, whether that order is made following final disposition of the proceeding or otherwise.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to sections 38 and 40 and subsections (2) and (3) of this section, a person must not disclose, or be compelled to disclose, in any civil, criminal, quasi-criminal, administrative or regulatory action or proceeding,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any oral or written information acquired in anticipation of, during or in connection with a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session,
any opinion disclosed in anticipation of, during or in connection with a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session, or
any document, offer or admission made in anticipation of, during or in connection with a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session.
in respect of any information, opinion, document, offer or admission that all of the participants agree in writing may be disclosed,
to any fee declaration, agreement to mediate or settlement document made in anticipation of, during or in connection with a pre-mediation meeting or a mediation session, or
to any information that does not identify the participants or the action and that is disclosed for research or statistical purposes only.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), if and only to the extent that it is necessary to do so for the purposes of section 34 or 35, a participant may disclose evidence of any act or failure to act of another participant that is alleged, for the purpose of section 34, to constitute a failure to comply with a provision of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No restriction on otherwise producible information
bcl:section.bcl:text: Nothing in this regulation precludes a person from introducing into evidence in any civil, criminal, quasi-criminal, administrative or regulatory action or proceeding any information or records produced in the course of the mediation that are otherwise producible or compellable in those proceedings.
A mediation is concluded when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all issues are resolved, or
the mediation session is completed and there is no agreement to continue.

bcl:section.bcl:text: When a mediation is concluded, the mediator must deliver a Certificate of Conclusion of Mediation in Form 5 to each of the participants who requests one or to their counsel.

The parties who have not been exempted from attending the mediation session must jointly appoint a mutually acceptable mediator within 14 days after service of this Notice.
Otherwise, any of those parties may apply to a designated roster organization for appointment of a mediator.
